skill.name: upgrading-expo
skill.description: Guidelines for upgrading Expo SDK versions and fixing dependency issues
skill.summary: Expert guidance for upgrading Expo SDK versions with step-by-step migration instructions
skill.author: expo

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The detected patterns are legitimate documentation of Expo CLI commands and official documentation URLs. Markdown code block fences were misidentified as backtick execution. No actual security risks present.

content.value_statement: Expo SDK upgrades involve complex dependency changes, React API migrations, and breaking changes. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for upgrading between SDK versions, ensuring compatibility with React 19, New Architecture, and React Compiler.
actual_capabilities: Provides step-by-step Expo SDK upgrade procedures
Documents React 19 migration patterns (useContext to use, forwardRef removal)
Explains New Architecture changes and compatibility requirements
Guides React Compiler enablement and cleanup
Lists deprecated packages with recommended replacements
Includes troubleshooting steps for common upgrade issues
limitations: Does not execute upgrade commands - only provides guidance
Cannot modify user project files automatically
Does not resolve custom dependency conflicts
Does not test app functionality after upgrades

use_cases.description: Get guidance on migrating from useContext to use hook, removing forwardRef wrappers, and updating Context.Provider syntax to the new React 19 format.

use_cases.title: New Architecture Migration
use_cases.description: Understand New Architecture requirements, verify Fabric is enabled, and troubleshoot native module compatibility issues.
use_cases.target_user: Teams enabling or verifying New Architecture support

best_practices: Run npx expo-doctor before upgrading to identify potential issues early
Back up your project and use version control before making major changes
Test thoroughly after each upgrade step, especially camera, audio, and navigation features
anti_patterns: Skipping the breaking changes review - always read release notes before upgrading
Running prebuild without checking if your project is a bare workflow app
Keeping deprecated packages instead of replacing them with recommended alternatives

faq.question: What is the safest way to upgrade Expo SDK?
faq.answer: Back up your project, run npx expo-doctor to identify issues, upgrade with npx expo install expo@latest, address breaking changes, clear caches, and test thoroughly. Upgrade one major version at a time for complex projects.

faq.question: Do I need to enable React Compiler in SDK 54?
faq.answer: React Compiler is stable in SDK 54 and recommended. Enable it by adding "experiments": { "reactCompiler": true } to app.json. Once enabled, you can remove manual useMemo and useCallback calls.

faq.question: How do I check if my native modules support New Architecture?
faq.answer: Check the module documentation for New Architecture support. Look for SDK 53+ compatibility notes. Review GitHub issues for known problems. Consider alternatives for unmaintained modules.

faq.question: What should I do if a dependency breaks after upgrading?
faq.answer: Check if a newer version of the package exists that supports the new SDK. Look for Expo-compatible alternatives. Remove patches in the patches/ directory that may be outdated. Consider using Expo modules when available.

faq.question: When should I run npx expo prebuild --clean?
faq.answer: Run prebuild --clean when upgrading requires native code changes, after updating package.json dependencies that include native code, or when troubleshooting iOS/Android build issues. Do not use in bare workflow without caution.

faq.question: What packages are deprecated in recent SDK versions?
faq.answer: Common deprecations include: expo-av replaced by expo-audio and expo-video, expo-permissions replaced by individual APIs, @expo/vector-icons replaced by expo-symbols, AsyncStorage replaced by expo-sqlite/localStorage, and expo-app-loading replaced by expo-splash-screen.
